summary: The Transportation Asset Management Simplification Act amends Title 23 of the United States Code to improve transportation asset management plans. It modifies existing regulations regarding state compliance, submission requirements, and opportunities to address deficiencies. The bill streamlines the recertification process, clarifies timelines for compliance, and allows for extensions to address any shortcomings. This includes modifications impacting the frequency and requirements for state submissions, extending the periods to address deficiencies, and providing clarifications on compliance determinations.
